result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeramiah A. Jefferson

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Review hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

INCLUDES 22CM664, 22CF866 AND 22CF1183: No contact with victim(s): A.P., S.R.L. and T.J.L.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 9:15 am. 
BRANCH 6 CASE.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for DDA Molly Lawrence. 
Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom, pro se. 

VRCW. Complaint Read to deft.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Time Limits preserved for Preliminary Hearing.

Arguments on bond.

COURT ORDERS: 
Cash Bond in the amount of $500.00 set in other open cases to cover this case as well. 

 CONDITIONS: 
- No driving without valid DL.
- Prints and photograph. 
- No contact with victim(s): S.R.L. and T.J.L.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

DATES:
